metadata.Name: HellaSwag
metadata.Description: HellaSwag is a dataset for commonsense natural language inference, designed to be challenging for state-of-the-art models while remaining easy for humans. It includes video captions from ActivityNet and how-to articles from WikiHow, with adversarially filtered machine-generated wrong answers.
metadata.Paper Title: HellaSwag: Can a Machine Really Finish Your Sentence?
metadata.Venue Title: HellaSwag: Can a Machine Really Finish Your Sentence?
Affiliations: Paul G. Allen School of Computer Science & Engineering, University of Washington
metadata.Abstract: In this paper, we present HellaSwag, a new dataset for commonsense natural language inference. Despite being trivial for humans (>95% accuracy), state-of-the-art models struggle (<48% accuracy). We achieve this via Adversarial Filtering (AF), a data collection paradigm that iteratively selects an adversarial set of machine-generated wrong answers. This dataset highlights the limitations of current deep pretrained models and suggests a path forward for NLP research, where benchmarks co-evolve with the evolving state-of-the-art.
